Executive Summary

This Risk Management Plan (RMP) has been prepared for the chlorination system at the North Attleborough Wastewater Treatment Facility located on Cedar Road in North Attleborough, Massachusetts.  The North Attleboro Wastewater Treatment Facility is committed to operating the facility in an environmentally responsible manner and to provide a safe work place for its employees and the surrounding community.

This Plan has been developed in accordance with Title 40 of the Code of Federal Regulations, Part 68, "Chemical Accident Prevention Provisions".  The purpose of these provisions and this RMP is to prevent accidental releases of toxic and flammable substances that can cause harm to the public and to the environment.



This RMP was developed for the North Attleborough Wastewater Treatment Facility specifically to prevent and mitigate accidental releases associated with storage and handling operations of chlorine at the North Attleborough facility.  The RMP provides a summary of the risk management program implemented at the North Attleborough Wastewater Treatment Facility and was developed following the Environmental Protection Agency's guidance documents for the regulated chemical.  The RMP is available to government agencies and the public for review.



Tighe & Bond has performed the requisite review and regulatory update necessary for this covered facility on their five year RMP Submission Anniversary.  This review included:



A:  A hazard analysis of the covered process based on a methodology involving checklists developed from EPA RMP Guidance, as well as a physical inspection of the covered process;

B:  Performance of an off site consequence analysis (OCA) taking into account data revised from the year 2010 census; and

C:  A general review of operating and maintenance procedures with facility operations and environmental personnel.



The following items provide an overview of the North Attleborough Wastewater Treatment Facility's RMP, in

accordance with 40 CFR 68.155.



Facility Description and Covered Process

The North Attleborough Wastewater Treatment Facility stores up to 8,000 pounds of chlorine in four, 2,000 pound cylinders for wastewater disinfection.  The chlorine is stored in a room equipped with ventilation and chlorine alarms.  The chlorine gas is mixed with water in the chlorinators and is directly injected into the treatment locations.



Release Scenarios

A worst case release scenario and three alternative release scenarios have been evaluated and documented in the facility RMP files.  The worst case and alternative release scenarios were reevaluated for the five year anniversary, updating population and receptor information.  Based on guidelines provided by EPA in the 2004 RMP Submit Instruction Manual, release scenario information is not provided in this Executive Summary.



Administrative and Engineering Controls

The North Attleborough Wastewater Treatment Facility has implemented a prevention program (RMP Program 2) to administratively limit the potential for a worst case or alternative release.  Specific measures employed in this program include safety reviews, hazard reviews, operating procedure reviews, training, maintenance and inspections.



Compliance audits are conducted at least once every (3) three years based on the schedule contained in 40 CFR 68.58.  Hazard reviews are completed at least once every five (5) years, or sooner if major changes occur, based on the schedule contained in 40 CFR 68.50.  Maintenance and inspections are conducted on process equipment at specified intervals as outlined in the North Attleborough Wastewater Treatment Facility's RMP.  Documentation of the most recent reviews, audits, inspections and maintenance are maintained at the facility.



Mitigation Measures

Certain engineering controls are used to mitigate the potential effects of the alternative release scenario and are listed in Section 8.4.d of the RMP submittal.



General Accide

ntal Prevention Program and Chemical Specific Prevention Items

The North Attleborough Wastewater Treatment Facility has implemented a Program 2 RMP to prevent the release of toxic substances that can cause harm to the public and the environment.  Program 2, in general, consists of the following:



A:  Safety Information (Sect. 68.48)

B:  Hazard Review (Sect. 68.50)

C:  Operating Procedures (Sect. 68.52)

D:  Training (Sect. 68.54)

E:  Maintenance (Sect. 68.56)

F:  Compliance Audits (Sect. 68.58)

G:  Incident Investigation (Sect. 68.60)

H:  Emergency Response Program (Sect. 68.90)



This Program 2 RMP has been implemented at the facility and the North Attleborough Wastewater Treatment Facility maintains a copy available for review on-site.



Five Year Accident History

There have been no releases of chlorine at the North Attleborough Wastewater Treatment Facility in the five (5) years preceding the submission of this RMP Update.



Emergency Response Program

The North Attleborough Wastewater Treatment Facility has coordinated its Emergency Response Program (ERP) with appropriate agencies as required under 40 CFR 68.90 to include the following activities:



A:  A public meeting and/or notification was made to the general public relative to chlorine stored at the facility.

B:  The Federal Bureau of Investigation was notified of the meeting date and location.

C:  Appropriate agencies were provided with ERP information such as the North Attleborough Wastewater Treatment Facility's ERP, offsite consequence analysis, prevention measures, etc.

D:  Tier II reports are submitted to appropriate agencies on an annual basis to periodically update facility emergency response information and chemical storage quantities.



Safety Improvements

The following list provides a summary of items implemented at the North Attleborough Wastewater Treatment Facility in association with this Plan that are designed to improve safety.



A:  Hazard Review (Updated every 5 years,

or prior to major process changes)

B:  Operating Procedures Review (Reviewed every 3 years as part of the compliance audit and prior to major process changes)

C:  Training (Conducted once every 3 years (minimum))

D:  Maintenance and Inspection (Frequency varies, but is defined in the facility's RMP files)

E:  Compliance Audit (Audit every 3 years)

F:  Emergency Response Program (Coordinated with local emergency response personnel)



A Process Hazard Analysis update and a Compliance Audit were recently conducted at the North Attleborough Wastewater Treatment Facility and involved operations, management and environmental personnel.  The assessments identified some minor recommendations that will be implemented within the next year.
